channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Indian police raid home of environmental activists over anti-fossil fuel campaign
item.description: Satat Sampada founders Harjeet Singh and Jyoti Aswathi say allegations are ‘baseless, biased and misleading’ Police have raided the home of one of Ind...

item.title: Tesco aiming for bumper 2026 after best Christmas market share in decade
item.description: Chain reports strong sales but shares drop 5% after analysts say third quarter performance was behind expectations Business live – latest updates Tesc...

item.title: German president criticises US foreign policy for leading to ‘breakdown of values’ underpinning world order – Europe live
item.description: Frank-Walter Steinmeier has strongly criticised the US foreign policy under Donald Trump German president Frank-Walter Steinmeier has strongly critici...

item.title: Starmer says Reform UK and Tories are in ‘cruel alliance’, as bill to get rid of two-child benefit cap unveiled – UK politics live
item.description: The legislation will be introduced today and the government says it will lift almost 500,000 children out of poverty According to a report by Larisa B...

item.title: Minneapolis shooting latest updates: demonstrations and vigils held across the US after woman in Minnesota fatally shot by ICE agent
item.description: Governor Tim Walz said he was prepared to deploy the National Guard and expressed outrage over the shooting Hello and welcome to the US politics live ...

item.title: Elon Musk's Grok AI appears to have made child sexual imagery, says charity
item.description: It said analysts discovered the images on a dark-web forum, by users who claimed to have used Grok

item.title: One million without heat and water after Russian strikes, Ukraine says
item.description: Efforts are continuing to restore services in Dnipropetrovsk, officials say, after wide-spread attacks in the southeast.

item.title: Captain Romero appears to call out Spurs hierachy
item.description: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero appears to take aim at the club's hierarchy, accusing them of telling "lies" in a since edited Instagram post.

item.title: England cricketer Brook apologises after nightclub altercation
item.description: England's Harry Brook apologises after being involved in an altercation with a nightclub bouncer the night before an ODI on the tour of New Zealand th...

item.title: Tesco and M&S report strong Christmas food sales
item.description: Both major retailers report strong food sales, but M&S says sales of clothing and homeware fell.
